reviews.text: Lovely Hotel, Lovely People, Lovely Resort (Beach not big) had a Lovely time !
reviews.title: "Turkish Delight"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good points:
reviews.title: Very well run hotel

reviews.text: Excellent location with mountains, beach, and small town.
reviews.title: i loved it!! it was a great stay!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very helpfull staff - especially the 'information officer' - all seemed polite and friendly.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.text: Fantastic breakfast. Lovely eating areas.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: I travelled with my husband and my 14 and 16 year old teenagers to the Yucelen in August. We had a family room which was very nice. It was divided into two rooms, one double and one twin with a lovely balcony overlooking the duck pond and pools. The room was cleaned every day with clean towels and sheets and some days flowers on the bed. Speaking to other hotel guests the quality of the rooms do vary! The hotel is set in beautiful grounds with a little stream running though to the sea. The restaurant overlooked the beach which was a great way to start the day. Breakfast was a Turkish Buffet serving breads cheeses and olives along with eggs, omlettes and pancakes freshly made to order. Service throughout was excellent. All staff were welcoming and friendly. Nihat and his team looked after us expertly. The pool and beach can get busy but generally we always found enough sun loungers. The resort was charming with numerous restaurants offering great food at excellent prices. Go to the Red Kitchen for Mezze.
reviews.title: Great holiday, we would come back!!

reviews.text: I'll let my photos speak for themselves, but I just wanted to write a little review to say how great the Yucelen hotel in Akyaka was. The hotel was very clean and the grounds were just lovely. We were staying on a Bed and Breakfast basis, but stayed in the 'Gencel' self catering apartments which are located directly opposite the hotel on a nice quiet street. We had full use of the hotel facilities but with the benefit of an additional smaller pool. The room was good, (I loved the two balconies). The cooking facilites were perhaps a little basic but there are such lovely cafes and restaurants nearby that we wouldn't have used them anyway. Breakfast was great, (especially the fresh bread and honey straight from the honeycomb). There was lots of choice, including cereal, cheeses, fruit, nuts, eggs, pancakes etc.
reviews.title: Great hotel, lovely town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great and did everything possible to make us welcome, (on the first morning one of them overheard my son saying that his pillow was too hard, and within 30 minutes they had delivered a soft fluffy one to our room!)
reviews.title: Lovely location but not a 4* hotel

reviews.text: The hotel has a good range of facilities such as a internet cafe, gym, massage services, indoor and outdoor pools, cinema nights, tabble tennis, darts tournaments, onsite doctor, and so on. There is a small kids club, for children aged 4-12, that runs Monday to Saturday, 9.30 - 12.30 and 2.00 - 5.00. We didn't use all of these facilities so I can't comment, but I thought someone might find it useful to know theye are there.
reviews.title: Lovely stay at the Yucelen

reviews.text: Akyaka itself is lovely. We could really relax and stroll around without being hassled by shopkeepers. We felt genuinely safe and even let our kids (13 and 7) take little walks to the shops by themselves which I wouldn't have done in a larger town. We really enjoyed taking them exploring in the woods next to the hotel where we saw lots of wildlife including wild tortoises, (it is part of Gokova National Park so the views along the coastline are gorgeous!) I was a little scared that Akyaka would be too quiet to keep the kids happy but we found plenty to do for a week.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay in a beautiful village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time at this hotel and resort. The pros for those thinking about booking this hotel:
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel in average resort

reviews.text: The room was reasonably spacious with a nice balcony and kept very clean with a good standard of bedding and towells. A plus was that the mattress was not as hard as those normally found in Turkish hotels! The pool was exceptionally picturesque, quiet, immaculately clean and there was no problem getting sunloungers (but it was the end of September). The restaurant had a lovely patio area with wonderful views and a good standard of service. There was a good choice of food for breakfast ranging from fresh fruit to cooked omlettes, fried or boiled eggs, fresh pancakes, cheeses, olives, breads etc. Evening meals were good, an a la carte resturant or buffett with a variety of cold mezze, a barbeque meat or kebab, selection of hot dishes, rice, chips etc.
reviews.title: the four Scousers return

reviews.text: The cons:
reviews.title: Good stay in this well run friendly hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was so hot by the pool that we decamped most days to the beach where there was a welcome breeze. However, the hotel's beach is small and the sunloungers are on top of each other, providing little space between you and your neighbour. The resort is small, less than an hours walk and you will have seen it all. Compared to other resorts we have visited, we felt there wasn't a huge choice of good restaurants or things to do. Beware booking trips through the holiday reps. We almost paid 190TL for a day's boat trip for two. After speaking to some guests, we walked down to the jetty and got our day's boat trip for 80TL!
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing time.....

reviews.text: All in all if you want some sun and a chilled out week doing nothing but relaxing with a book, then this hotel wouldn't be a bad decision.
reviews.title: Even better than last year!

reviews.text: This hotel is a jewel with nice architecture, as well as quaint and beautiful gardening. It is located right at the beach in the small village of Akyaka, which is mostly frequented by Turkish tourists. We stayed during the off season in October, so the atmosphere was very relaxed. The service was great from beginning to end, we felt welcome and were treated very friendly at all times.
reviews.title: Great, great vacation spot

reviews.text: We had a family room, where the parents and kids beds are separated by a wooden wall with a glass window (which can be closed with blinds). The room was sufficiently spacious for a family of four and there was also enough storage space. The room was clean and had a good standard with appealing furnishings and bathroom facilities. There was a safe and small television with international channels available. It is noteworthy that the water pressure and temperature in the shower was extremely good. The heating & cooling system also worked perfect. The room had a small balcony. The views from the balcony depend on the room location, but in most instances you will have a view of the nice garden and pool, the forest and sometimes the ocean as well.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: We had booked the all-inclusive option. The restaurant is located on the sea side of the hotel and has a terrace with fantastic views on the bay. The food was very good and for the most part followed a Turkish theme. There was also standard fare like pasta, French fries etc. available, so most kids should be happy with that selection as well. The breakfast buffet offered a wide selection of hot and cold foods. For lunch there was a choice to either eat at the main buffet in the restaurant or at the snack bar, which offered pizza and doener. In addition to the main buffet restaurant there was an a la carte restaurant for a more formal dining experience available, which is right upstairs on top of the buffet restaurant. Afternoon sweets, tea and coffee were served at the bar in the main building.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Yuecelen Hotel has two outside pools, a kids pool with a slide, which are both not heated and an indoor pool at cozy temperatures. There is sauna and fitness available at no charge and massages can be booked for a fee. The hot tub was not functional during our stay, but that might change over time. Overall, the indoor wet areas were not in the best of shape and proper lighting for the pool was an issue, as the indoor pool was only illuminated by a standing lamp next to the pool, which seemed like a bit of a safety concern. The hotel has free wi-fi in the lobby area, and if you get a room close to the main building you might get access from there as well. There is small computer room with two machines where you can access the internet. The hotel has a little clothing store and mini-club (in season only). The beach has grey/yellow sand and is not very big. There are sun chairs available, but I can imagine it gets fairly crowded there during high season as the beach front is not very big. Due to the fact that the beach is located at the end of the bay, the water is very calm and shallow. This is ideal for kids. Some water sports, like surfing, tread boat rental and kanu are available for charge right at the beachfront of the hotel. The hotel also has a small playground in the beach vicinity. The nearby harbor offers boat cruises up the river delta and along the coast and small islands of the bay (not a hotel offering). Within a short walking distance you also find restaurants, little stores and Goekova park. It should be noted that there are a good number of free running cats and dogs in and around the hotel. For the most part these are very friendly and clean animals, but this might not be to everybody’s liking.
reviews.title: A very relaxing stay, although this is not a 4* Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have a car available or choose to rent one on site, you have the opportunity to take great day trips to archeological sites (like Didim und Kunos), tourist spots (Marmaris & Bodum, which is also offers Haliakanassos, one of the seven wonders of the world), beautiful landscapes (Hisaroesnue) and authentic Turkish cities (like the market in Mugla). In all, this is a perfect holiday destination to discover and experience Turkey, and we will be back this fall for more!
reviews.title: Mix Bag
